channel.title: Thoughts of a Hacker
channel.description: Reflections and reading notes for Hackers in the Bazaar.

item.title: Reading 10: King of the ball
item.description: What do you make of Linux's success? Is it proof of the power of hackers in the bazaar? Or was it simply a matter of fortunate circumstances? Will there ever be another open source success story as big as Linux?

item.title: Reading 9: Birth of a nerd OS
item.description: Do you find the story of Linus Torvalds' upbringing and creation of Linux inspiring, interesting, or irrelevant? How does his story compare to other computing industry titans such as Bill Gates, Steve Jobs, or Mark Zuckerberg? What do you wish your story to be?

item.title: Reading 7: The Cathedral and the Bazaar
item.description: From your experience, which model of software development is superior: the cathedral or the bazaar? Which is the future of software development? Are the two models mutually exclusive?

item.title: Reading 6: Wealth Creation
item.description: How important is the choice of programming language in software development and computer science? What is lacking in our current set of tools? What ideas or features will continue to persist far into the future?

item.title: Reading 5: Programming languages
item.description: How important is the choice of programming language in software development and computer science? What is lacking in our current set of tools? What ideas or features will continue to persist far into the future?

item.title: Reading 4: Nerds and Hackers
item.description: Is Paul Graham's version of a hacker compatible with Steven Levy's description? Do his arguments for and description of the modern hacker change your mind about what it means to be a hacker or the desirability of being one?

item.title: Reading 3: Game Hackers
item.description: Can the Hacker Ethic truly and fully survive in a world of commercial and proprietary software? Is it better to be a 'professional programmer (the goal-oriented responsible engineer)' or is it better to be a programmer with 'love for [computing] in [your] heart' and 'hacker perfectionism in [your] soul'?

item.title: Reading 2: Hardware Hackers
item.description: How important is spreading the Hacker Ethic to a wider audience? Is compromising ideals, worth having a larger impact on the world?

item.title: Reading 1: True Hackers
item.description: What does it mean to be a 'true hacker'? Do you aspire to be one? Why or why not?
